answers.answer: HiThanks for writing to the forum!A combined infection of EBV, HSV2 and fungus can be very weakening. You could in addition be suffering from some problem of the gut—like fungus there, TB of the gut or any variant of irritable bowel/ulcerative colitis/Crohn’s/Celiac disease. Was the stool examination done? Also diabetes needs to be ruled out as this makes an infection persist in the body.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!
No a stool exam has not been done.  All tests for diabetes have been negative.  Any other ideas?

question: I am a white male in my 30's.  I have always been very healthy and active in sports all of my life until last summer.  The only thing I can pinpoint is that I had a one night stand with a girl that I did not know.  There was protected sex, lots of petting and unprotected oral performed on her.  About 40 days later, It became hard for me to urninate.  I went to the urologist and they found no bacteria in my urine but, I had a swollen prostate.  I was prescribed cipro for 30 days.  I developed thrush at the end of the course and was given a diflucan (that didn't work).   They also put me on doxycyline because I was still having burning sensations and restricted flow.  This didn't help either.  My girlfriend had was diagnosed with BV at the same time.  I became really sick about a month after this.  Fever, headache, nausea, fatigue, thrush, tingling hands and feet, bumps in my mouth, swollen tonsils, aching joints all over and diarrhea.  My  ENT told me that I tested positive for EBV.  I also tested positive for HSV2.   My girlfriend has had 2 outbreaks of shingles since this episode.  One in the fall and one at the beginning of this year.  The latter outbreak was pretty severe, It crossed center line which is pretty uncommon.  I have become concerned that this may be a STD.  I went and had all testing done. Syphillis, gonn, chlamydia, hep a/b/c, Hiv 1/2, all negative at 4 months.  Alot of my symptoms have subsided except for occasional fatigue, oral thursh, and achy joints.  I have been on Nystatin 3/day now for almost 75 days and still having oral thrush.  I am also experiencing pencil thin stools once in a while that are mostly green and soft (dissolve to nothing when you flush the toilet).  I have lower abdominal pains once and a while and a dull pain at the base of my sternum that fluctuates right to left sometimes.  I  can't get an answer from my Dr on why I can't be cured.  All of my CBC's, LFT, and other blood work come back normal!  I have become so paranoid of this being some kind of std, I ordered a HIV PCR DNA test that came back negative at 9 1/2 months. My girlfriend is also fatigued and having a wide range on her periods.  One will be next to nothing and the next really heavy.  She also has complained of lower abdomen pains recently as well.  She had a PAP a couple months ago that came back perfect.I am so confused to whats causing these problems.   It has been almost a year now,  does anyone have any ideas that could be causing all of this?
title: Can't figure it out!
